summary_gpt: The filing announces the schedule for IHCL's Q4 and FY 2024-25 results presentation via a global conference call on May 5, 2025, including dial-in details for international participants. It is a standard regulatory communication without any indication of financial performance or strategic updates.

The company has scheduled a board meeting on May 5, 2025, to approve its audited financial results for the quarter and year ended March 31, 2025, along with a dividend recommendation. The trading window has been closed from March 25, 2025, until 48 hours after the results are announced.

The Indian Hotels Company Limited announced its audited financial results for FY 2024-25 with an unmodified auditor's opinion and recommended a dividend of ₹2.25 per share, higher than the previous year's dividend. The results and dividend are subject to shareholder approval at the upcoming AGM.

The Indian Hotels Company Limited announced its audited financial results for FY 2024-25 with an unmodified auditor's opinion and recommended a dividend of ₹2.25 per share, higher than the previous year's dividend. The results and dividend are subject to shareholder approval at the upcoming AGM.

The Indian Hotels Company Limited announced its audited financial results for FY 2024-25 with an unmodified auditor's opinion and proposed a dividend of ₹2.25 per share, higher than the previous year's ₹1.75. The results and dividend are subject to shareholder approval at the upcoming AGM.

The filing reports IHCL's strong financial performance for FY25, including record revenues, EBITDA, and profit, driven by strategic expansion, brand growth, and industry tailwinds. It highlights double-digit RevPAR growth, increased hotel portfolio, and positive industry fundamentals supporting future growth.

The company announced the appointment of M/s. Neville Daroga & Associates as its Secretarial Auditors for a five-year term starting FY 2025-26, pending shareholder approval. The firm is experienced in corporate governance and compliance, with a proven track record in providing secretarial audit services to listed companies.

Indian Hotels Company Limited (IHCL) reported twelve consecutive quarters of record financial performance for FY2024-25, with significant revenue growth, new hotel signings, and openings, along with a proposed 20% dividend. The company plans to invest over INR 1,200 crores in FY2026 to enhance assets and digital capabilities, expecting continued double-digit revenue growth driven by strong operational performance and sector demand.
